parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Feminine Plural
str2: To go out, come out. From ek and erchomai; to issue.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A tomb, sepulcher, monument. From mneme; a remembrance, i.e. Cenotaph.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To flee, escape, shun. Apparently a primary verb; to run away; by implication, to shun; by analogy, to vanish.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
A trembling, quaking, fear. From tremo; a 'trembling', i.e. Quaking with fear.
From existemi; a displacement of the mind, i.e. Bewilderment, 'ecstasy'.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From phobos; to frighten, i.e. to be alarmed; by analogy, to be in awe of, i.e. Revere.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
